weekly_top_story.headline: Massive Flooding Across Southeast Asia and South Asia Kills Over 1,000 People
weekly_top_story.summary: Devastating floods and landslides in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Malaysia have claimed over 1,000 lives, with Indonesia alone experiencing 469 deaths, prompting emergency response efforts and international humanitarian attention.

stories.headline: Trump Administration Announces End to World AIDS Day Commemoration
stories.summary: The Trump administration declared it will no longer officially commemorate World AIDS Day, marking a significant shift in U.S. public health policy and international health advocacy.

stories.headline: Israeli Forces Conduct Raid in Syria, Killing 13 People
stories.summary: Israeli military forces raided a village outside Damascus, killing 13 people including two children, claiming to target Lebanese Muslim Brotherhood members in the ongoing pattern of incursions since Assad's regime fell.

stories.headline: Philippines: Tens of Thousands Protest Against President Marcos Jr. Over Corruption Scandal
stories.summary: Mass protests erupted in Manila as citizens demand President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s resignation following revelations that his government received billions in kickbacks from faulty flood control projects.
